![Daheeyeon Garden (Îã§Ìù¨Ïó∞)](/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620108_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Daheeyeon Garden is a major tea farm on Jeju Island, which has the best conditions for growing great tea in a natural environment. Jeju has a year-round average temerature of 16‚ÑÉ and nutrient-rich soil with plenty of water for the tea plants to grow well. The two cave cafes, Evergreen Luce Garden and Eve Hall, serve naturally fermented green tea bread, cookies, muffins, green tea latte and green tea juice.

Evergreen Luce outdoor garden was built inside a cave formed naturally by a volcanic eruption. Despite being in a cave, this outdoor garden has ponds, bridges, indigenous trees and flowers. Eve Hall is located through a hole in the cave ceiling and can be only reached after passing through a tunnel-like cave. The deepest part of Eve Hall is roughly 30 meters and is home to bats; if you are lucky, you might even see a few. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)

+82-64-784-9030| |parking:|Available| |restdate:|N/A (Open all year round)| |usetime:|* Varies by season; please make an inquiry in advance.| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Admission Fees:|* Varies by season; please make an inquiry in advance.| |Available Facilities:|Tea culture center, Daheeyeon restaurant, Gotjawal Cave, Cave Cafe, green tea field, Bille Pond, zipline, etc. | |Restrooms:|Available| |Reservation Info. for Natives:|Advanced reservation required for experience programs.| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620105_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620105_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620106_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620106_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620107_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620107_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620109_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620109_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620110_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620110_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620111_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620111_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620112_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620112_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620113_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620113_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620114_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620114_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620115_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-19-1658241314969/1620115_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-64-782-0005](tel:+82647820005) - [üè†www.daheeyeon.com](http://www.daheeyeon.com/) ```googleMap latitude: 33.4871596654 longitude: 126.7061797858 title: 117, Seongyo-ro, Jeju-si, Jeju-do ``` ## Directions [Local Bus]
From Jeju International Airport, take Bus No. 38 and get off at Jocheon-eup Gwannae/Seonin-dong Bus Stop.
Transfer to Bus No. 900 and get off at Gyeongdeokwon Bus Stop.

[Taxi]
Approx. 40 min from Jeju International Airport.

data.title: Daheeyeon Garden (Îã§Ìù¨Ïó∞)
data.description:
Daheeyeon Garden is a major tea farm on Jeju Island, which has the best conditions for growing great tea in a natural environment. Jeju has a year-round average temerature of 16‚ÑÉ and nutrient-rich soil with plenty of water for the tea plants to grow well. The two cave cafes, Evergreen Luce Garden and Eve Hall, serve naturally fermented green tea bread, cookies, muffins, green tea latte and green tea juice.

Evergreen Luce outdoor garden was built inside a cave formed naturally by a volcanic eruption. Despite being in a cave, this outdoor garden has ponds, bridges, indigenous trees and flowers. Eve Hall is located through a hole in the cave ceiling and can be only reached after passing through a tunnel-like cave. The deepest part of Eve Hall is roughly 30 meters and is home to bats; if you are lucky, you might even see a few.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jeju Loveland (Ï†úÏ£ºÎü¨Î∏åÎûúÎìú)
dataList.description:
Jeju Loveland is a sculpture theme park based on sensuality and eroticism. Twenty artists, mainly graduates of top art school Hongik University, participated in the work and led to its opening in November 2004. It was the first such museum in Korea at that time. The spacious park (39,667 m¬≤) is home to over 140 sculptures (40 within the gallery and 100 outside). The park as a whole looks like a piece of land art.

Jeju Loveland is open every day and it usually takes 30-40 minutes to look around the park. Jeju Loveland houses a glass-dome restaurant, an outdoor caf√©, an art shop, and various works which visitors can touch. Jeju Loveland is an attractive place where eroticism is approached in an artistic and witty manner.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jeju Jungmun Resort (Ï§ëÎ¨∏Í¥ÄÍ¥ëÎã®ÏßÄ)
dataList.description: Jungmun Resort is an international tourist resort developed by the Korea Tourism Organization in 1978. The resort spans the areas of Jungmun, Daepo, and Saekdal-don in the location that best promotes Jejus unique natural beauty and geographical features. There are several attractions within the resort property, such as Pacific Land, Yeomiji Botanic Garden, a fishing village for tourists, Seonimgyo Bridge, Cheonjeyeonpokpo Falls, and Jungmun Beach. Internationally famous hotel branches, such as The Shilla Hotel, Lotte Hotel, and Hyatt Hotel are situated here, allowing visitors to enjoy the utmost comfort while taking pleasure in Jejus nature.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jeju Jeolmul Recreational Forest (Ï†úÏ£ºÏ†àÎ¨ºÏûêÏó∞Ìú¥ÏñëÎ¶º)
dataList.description:
Jeju Jeolmul Recreational Forest opened on July 23, 1997. The forest is comprised of both a natural Japanese cedar forest and a man-made forest. The combination of the sea breeze and the shade of the forest canopy over the walking paths make it a cool attraction all year round.

The recreational forest features a promenade, waterfall, pond, grass square, wood-crafting studio, and more. There are forest cabins available for lodging.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jeju Horse Park (Ï°∞ÎûëÎßêÏ≤¥ÌóòÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description: Jeju Horse Park offers a venue to promote Jeju‚Äôs horse culture in an easy and fun way. The park has kept intact the 600-year history  of nomadic culture at the site of Gasi-ri Village which used to house Gammajang, the place for raising the best horses during the Joseon dynasty. The park includes the Jeju Horse Museum, Ttarabi horseback riding track, Maeum Cafe, Mongol Yurt Guesthouse, camping site, Art Shop, and an experience place to focus on the Project for a New Cultural Space Creation through the support of the Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs. The Jeju Horse Museum was the first national museum created by a village and its main theme covers the history and culture of the village. It is also regarded as a new form of community business model.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jeju Gwandeokjeong Hall (Í¥ÄÎçïÏ†ï(Ï†úÏ£º))
dataList.description: One of the oldest standing buildings on Jeju Island, Gwandeokjeong Hall was built by Pastor Sin Suk-cheong in the 30th year of King Sejongs reign (1448) as a training ground. For its historic contribution to strengthening the mind and soul of soldiers (Gwandeok literally means an exercise of mind and virtue), Gwangdeokjeong Hall was designated as Treasure No. 322 in 1963. Today, the hall serves as a model of excellence in soldier training.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jeju Bultapsa Temple (Î∂àÌÉëÏÇ¨(Ï†úÏ£º))
dataList.description: Located in Samyang-dong, Jeju-si, Bultapsa Temple is a branch of Gwaneumsa Temple, the headquarters of the 23rd district of the Jogye Order of Korean Buddhism. The temple is nestled at the foot of Wondangbong Peak (alt. 170.4 meters). The temple started out as the Buddhist shrine Wondangsa, one of three temples in Jeju during the Yuan dynasty. Most of the temple was damaged due to the Jeju Uprising on April 3, 1948 and it was rebuilt in 1953. Later, the temple underwent renovations and extension works to get to the current conditions. Today, the temple has Daeungjeon Hall, Yosachae monk quarters, Jonggak Bell Tower, and Cheonwangmun Gate. The temples five-story stone pagoda is Jejus only stone pagoda from the Goryeo dynasty. It was designated Treasure No. 1187 in November 1993.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jeju Art Park (Forest Fantasia) (Ï†úÏ£ºÏ°∞Í∞ÅÍ≥µÏõê(Ìè¨Î†àÏä§Ìä∏ ÌåêÌÉÄÏßÄÏïÑ))
dataList.description: Jeju Art Park opened in October 1987 in a large primeval forest. The park features around 160 sculptures made by 109 famous Korean artists in the theme of Meeting of Nature, Art, and People. Each of the sculptures is set to harmonize with the beautiful natural surroundings. The park also features various facilities to enjoy, such as art events, an exhibition hall, and an observation deck with views of Hallasan Mountain and Marado Island, the southernmost land of Korea.
dataList.author: korea-tour
